TopicTitle: "You know you messed it up when..." thread

Articles.Content:
When you realize you forgot to extend the solar panels on the probe. (also happens to me a lot)

This particular problem has scrubbed so many missions of mine, I now have a rule that AS SOON as I add a probe body, I attach 3 of the OX-STAT panels to it, as an emergency backup. That's saved tons of my missions, although not all, as sometimes you end up in the shadow of a planetary body on an intercept course with the dirt ><
When you spend a good deal of time planning/building your Tylo landing mission, finally get there and while attempting to land realize your TWR is less than 1.

You know when you messed it up when you time warp and miss the maneuver node.

SO many times I have done this. I'm too impatient to wait to I'm like "A little warping can't hurt." Next thing I know the time in the bottom right corner says T+ 19 min 54 sec

Three days with no sleep docking module after module to your beautiful new space station, then in your sleep deprived state hitting "End flight"

I literally think I would delete the game then. I'm not even kidding.
When you realize that you forgot to equip your return capsule with a parachute.

When you realize you derped and read your orbit the wrong way around, so that after your retrograde burn you aren't headed for the designated landing spot on the day side of the mun, but your rover delivery system instead smashes itself to bits on some mountain on the dark side, because you also forgot about landing lights.
When, for some reason, your F9 button does not work...
When your rescue ship has no room for the rescuee.
When your re-entry module's parachutes don't open, because you forgot them.

Aligned for gravity turn, burning full throttle, and you're losing altitude slowly.

The engines are on a higher stage than the decouplers under them. GEE THANKS DEFAULTS.

'On escape trajectory out of the sun'.
When you spend a hour and a half getting the perfect orbit and realize its at a 38 degree angle..
When your interplanetary transfer stage has to finish the LKO burn.

Three days with no sleep docking module after module to your beautiful new space station, then in your sleep deprived state hitting "End flight"

If you don't regularly quicksave, you can still alt-f4 out of the game then restart it, it'll reload to the last autosave
This happens:
When you spend hours designing and building a prefect shuttle to LKO just to discover it doesn't like re-entry

When you forgot to open your solar panels on your probe before going into warp. (This has happened to me like 5 times now and I rage every time it happens XD)

Yes, I know that people have already posted something similar to this.

Why is it that I never experience over half of what is listed in this thread--is there something wrong with me?

You're not trying hard enough.
When you lose. You don't just fail, you lose. Game over.

When you realise that you forget the parachutes on your return vehicle (many people do it seems).

OMG< I was just going to write this. I had to do a rescue in space because of this.

When this happens:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/37109-Easter-Hunt-%28no-spoilers-though%29-%28picture-heavy%29

When Desfred Kerman decides to orbit the Mun after stepping foot on it

And:
When KSP's Kerbal generator runs out of names.

when you realise that you're coming in to dock with your space station at 30m/s...

I call that "Docking with Emphasis!"

When you come in for a "harder than originally intended" landing

and you hit F5 instead of F9...

So many times

When you warp right past your MÃƒÂ¼n encounter and go screaming out back into space.

(Did it for the first time today, don't think it'll be the last.
